text: The Old Masonic Temple in Trenton, Mercer County, New Jersey, United States, is a historic building built in 1793 at the corner of Front and Willow (or Barrack) streets near the New Jersey State House, and across the street from the Old Barracks. In 1915 when a new building was constructed for the Trenton Lodge, the old building was moved half a block south to 102 Barrack Street. It has served as a Masonic Lodge, a school, a shop for a furnisher and upholsterer, a museum, and is now a tourist information center. HABS NJ-141 Written Historical and Descriptive Data, undated. In 1970 the building became part of the State House Historic District listed by the National Register of Historic Places. ==References== ==External links== * HABS drawings, photos and data Category:Buildings and structures in Trenton, New Jersey Category:Clubhouses on the National Register of Historic Places in New Jersey Category:Historic district contributing properties in New Jersey Category:Houses completed in 1793 Category:Former Masonic buildings in New Jersey Category:National Register of Historic Places in Trenton, New Jersey
title: Old Masonic Temple (Trenton, New Jersey)
